cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 171, Number 40 (Monday, March 3, 2025)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. JAMES:H.R. 1796.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Pursuant to Clause 7(c)(1) of Rule XII of the Rules of theHouse of Representatives, the constitutional authority forenacting this legislation is found in Article I, Section 8 ofthe United States Constitution, specifically:Article I, Section 8, Clause 1: The General Welfare Clause,which grants Congress the power to provide for the generalwelfare of the United States, including promoting publichealth initiatives.Article I, Section 8, Clause 3: The Commerce Clause, whichgrants Congress the authority to regulate commerce among theseveral states, including the regulation of healthcareservices and programs that impact interstate commerce.Article I, Section 8, Clause 18: The Necessary and ProperClause, which grants Congress the authority to enact lawsnecessary and proper for carrying out its enumerated powers,including the implementation of public health programs toaddress diseases such as sickle cell disease.[Page H946]

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.title: Sickle Cell Disease and Other Heritable Blood Disorders Research, Surveillance, Prevention, and Treatment Act of 2025

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

bill.title: Sickle Cell Disease and Other Heritable Blood Disorders Research, Surveillance, Prevention, and Treatment Act of 2025

item.title: Sickle Cell Disease and Other Heritable Blood Disorders Research, Surveillance, Prevention, and Treatment Act of 2025
Sickle Cell Disease and Other Heritable Blood Disorders Research, Surveillance, Prevention, and Treatment Act of 2025
To amend the Public Health Service Act to reauthorize a sickle cell disease prevention and treatment demonstration program.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
